definition: tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad

sentences.english: Currently, a wave of enthusiasm personality household domestic kitchen cabinet industry and also try dance.
sentences.chinese: 目前，個性家居風潮正勁，國內廚櫃業也聞風而舞。

sentences.english: It didn't take very long for the latest fashion trend to catch on.
sentences.chinese: 這個最新的時尚潮流沒多久就蔚爲一股風潮。

sentences.english: It looks like reality TV shows are here to stay.
sentences.chinese: 看來真人真事的電視節目已成爲風潮。

sentences.english: The two trends of overthrowing Sun Yat-sen were merely a fuse of reorganization Restoration League.
sentences.chinese: 二次“倒孫風潮”不過是光復會重組的導火線而已。

sentences.english: After Chongqing opened the port, "modern agitation " poured into Sichuan Basin along the course of the Changjiang River.
sentences.chinese: 重慶開埠後，“近代風潮”沿長江航線湧進四川盆地。

sentences.english: Television shows were blacked out as the union trouble spread.
sentences.chinese: 由於工會風潮蔓延，電視停止了播放。

sentences.english: Shi Guobao was considered a folk usurious agitation" claw king".
sentences.chinese: 石國豹被認爲是民間高利貸風潮的“爪王”。

sentences.english: The vinegar-drinking trend gained momentum in 2004, when black vinegar became all the rage.
sentences.chinese: 2004年黑醋風靡一時之際，飲醋風潮開始盛行。

sentences.english: And this whole cloud computing fad?
sentences.chinese: 這場雲計算風潮又怎樣呢？

sentences.english: But a wave of consolidation seems to be driven this year by French private equity house AXA.
sentences.chinese: 法國的私募股權公司AXA似乎引領了一股併購風潮。

sentences.english: Don't lose more by joining the stampede of buy-high, sell-low market timers.
sentences.chinese: 不要應爲參與高買低賣的搶購風潮而虧損更多。

sentences.english: For collage students, it is encouraging to travel abroad during summer or winder vacation.
sentences.chinese: 大學生利用寒暑假出國遊學儼然形成一種風潮。

sentences.english: Lunzan style evolvement in pre-four history works is closely contacted with the era disputation vogue.
sentences.chinese: 前四史論贊文體演變與時代論議風潮密切相關。

sentences.english: A decade-long run of mergers in the banking industry has concentrated power in fewer hands.
sentences.chinese: 十年的銀行業購併風潮讓權力集中於少數人之手。

sentences.english: Rumor spread the prices would go up, many peopel stampeded into a wave of panic buying.
sentences.chinese: 謠傳物價要上漲，很多人捲入了搶購的風潮中。

sentences.english: Behind the transformation are myriad forms of government intervention.
sentences.chinese: 在這風潮的背後是滿是政府幹預的影子。

definition: to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
(of markets, industries, infectious diseases etc) rising/emerging/in the ascendant
Xinxing county in Yunfu 雲浮|云浮[Yun2 fu2], Guangdong/Xinxing or Hsinhsing district of Kaohsiung city 高雄市[Gao1 xiong2 shi4], south Taiwan
to lead to/to trigger/to initiate/to cause/to evoke (emotions)
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
to crane one's neck/to await eagerly/to lead/to show the way
